title: Indian banks want customers, but no smartphones please
description: Indian banks transferred $2.5 trillion, or 80% of GDP, through smartphones. However, the RBI is now raising liquidity requirements for mobile-linked deposits, drawing a parallel to the SVB failure. This move aims to ensure banks' stability but could affect credit growth and net interest margins.
